revised_title: Embryonic Axis Regulation and Primitive Streak Reversal in Chick Development
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on chick blastoderms, reversing lengths of the primitive streak and observing the effects on embryo development. They found that many embryos developed normally after the operation, and that the orientation of the primitive streak does not control the orientation of the embryo. The results suggest that the primitive streak is highly labile in its powers of differentiation and is subject to control by the surrounding blastoderm.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
